reporter_caption.center: IN MATTER OF DERMATES, 159 Wn. App. 1010 (2011)

caption.center: In The Matter Of The Personal Restraint Of ROBERT DERMATES,

court.center: The Court of Appeals of Washington, Division One.

posture.unpublished: [EDITOR'S NOTE: This case is unpublished as indicated by the issuing court.] Petition for relief from personal restraint.

opinion_text.unpublished: Remanded by unpublished per curiam opinion.

Robert Dermates filed this personal restraint petition challenging, among other things, a sentencing condition that he "not possess or access pornographic materials, as directed by the supervising Community Corrections Officer."[fn1] The State's concession that the condition is unconstitutionally vague is well taken. See State v. Bahl, 164 Wn.2d 739,193 P.3d 678 (2008).
Accordingly, we accept the State's concession and grant the personal restraint petition. The matter is remanded to the trial court for amendment of the judgment and sentence consistent with Bahl, 164 Wn.2d at 758-62.
Remanded.
[fn1] The Acting Chief Judge previously dismissed Dermates' remaining claims as frivolous.
